snippet: One of Egypt’s most prominent liberal intellectuals was charged with insulting the judiciary because he criticized a court ruling against three American nonprofits that promote democracy.
abstract: Egyptian prosecutor charges liberal intellectual Amr Hamzawy with insulting judiciary after he posts message on Twitter criticizing court ruling against pro-democracy American nonprofits; charges offer glimpse of how military-led government may apply new Constitution's free speech provisions to intensify pressure on dissenters.
lead_paragraph: One of Egypt’s most prominent liberal intellectuals was charged with insulting the judiciary because he criticized a court ruling against three American nonprofits that promote democracy.

headline.main: Egypt Says Twitter Post by Liberal Was Crime
headline.print_headline: Egypt Says Twitter Post by Liberal Was Crime
